properties.Name: Delbrook Parking Lot
properties.Address: 600 W Queens Road, District Of North Vancouver
properties.AmenityLocation: The parking lot is located on W Queens Road between Delbrook Avenue and Stanley Avenue.
properties.TermsOfUse: The driver and/or carrier are responsible for verifying all clearances and restrictions when accessing the parking lot, and for ensuring the vehicle is operated in compliance with all applicable municipal bylaws and provincial and federal regulations. Use of the parking lot as a temporary respite area is provided on an "as is" basis without warranty of any kind, whether express or implied, including without limitation, any implied warranties of fitness for a particular purpose. The District of North Vancouver is not responsible for any injury, loss of life, or loss or damage to a vehicle or its contents resulting from the use of the parking lot. The District of North Vancouver, in its sole discretion, may at any time without notice revise the terms and conditions of use for the parking lot, or terminate its use as a temporary respite area at any time, for any reason, without any notice and without any liability to any person or business entity.
properties.Comments: The truck (i.e., the power unit, not the trailer), must either be base-plated in another jurisdiction (e.g., AB, WA etc.) or if base-plated in BC, the rating territory on the vehicle registration/insurance documents must be a rating territory other than D (Lower Mainland) or E (Maple Ridge/Pitt Meadows) as per ICBC's Basic Insurance Tariff, Schedule A. Consistent with NSC Bulletin 01-2020 (Link), drivers and carriers are advised to ensure that they maintain records to clearly indicate the driver is actively providing COVID-19 relief and make those records available to a bylaw enforcement officer or a peace officer if asked to do so. Additionally, the trailer or semi-trailer, as applicable, must at all times remain hitched to the power unit (i.e., no unhitched trailers or semi-trailers are permitted in a temporary respite area at any time).
properties.DirectionsToWashroom: Westview Shopping Centre is located within walking distance of the parking lot at 2601 Westview Drive. Head west on W Queens Road to Westview Drive, then south on Westview Drive towards Hwy 1. Google Directions
properties.DirectionsToFood: Westview Shopping Centre is located within walking distance of the parking lot at 2601 Westview Drive. Head west on W Queens Road to Westview Drive, then south on Westview Drive towards Hwy 1. Google Directions

properties.Name: United Boulevard Industrial Area
properties.AmenityLocation: Brigantine Drive, Hartley Avenue, Schooner Street, and Fawcett Road are located in the United Boulevard Industrial Area.
properties.TermsOfUse: The driver and/or carrier are responsible for verifying all clearances and restrictions when accessing the area, and for ensuring the vehicle is operated in compliance with all applicable municipal bylaws and provincial and federal regulations. On-street parking in the area is provided on an "as is" basis without warranty of any kind, whether express or implied, including without limitation, any implied warranties of fitness for a particular purpose.  The City of Coquitlam is not responsible for any injury, loss of life, or loss or damage to a vehicle or its contents resulting from the use of on-street parking in this area. The City of Coquitlam, in its sole discretion, may at any time without notice revise the terms and conditions of on-street parking in the area, or terminate on-street parking in the area, for any reason, without any notice and without any liability to any person or business entity.
properties.Comments: Curbside parking for heavy trucks is allowed 24/7 in industrial areas in the City of Coquitlam (Coquitlam Street and Traffic Bylaw No. 4402, Section 11). Trailers or semi-trailers must be attached to the power unit (i.e., a vehicle capable of towing the trailer or semi-trailer). Please follow all posted signs and other requirements in Bylaw No. 4402. Link to Bylaw Consistent with NSC Bulletin 01-2020 (Link), drivers and carriers are advised to ensure that they maintain records to clearly indicate the driver is actively providing COVID-19 relief and make those records available to a bylaw enforcement officer or a peace officer if asked to do so.
properties.DirectionsToWashroom: Portable toilets are available for driver use at the Tim Horton's located at 1450 United Boulevard. Google Maps
properties.DirectionsToFood: Food options in the area include a Tim Horton's and Wendy's located at 1450 United Boulevard, and a Triple Os drive through and Starbucks Drive through on United Boulevard at Schooner Street. Google Maps

properties.Name: Parking Lot #109
properties.AmenityLocation: The parking lot is located at the intersection of East Hastings Street and Renfrew Street. There are two access points off Renfrew Street on Pender Street and one access point westbound on East Hastings Street.
properties.TermsOfUse: The driver and/or carrier are responsible for verifying all clearances and restrictions when accessing the parking lot, and for ensuring the vehicle is operated in compliance with all applicable municipal bylaws and provincial and federal regulations. Use of the parking lot as a temporary respite area is provided on an "as is" basis without warranty of any kind, whether express or implied, including without limitation, any implied warranties of fitness for a particular purpose. The City of Vancouver and the Vancouver Board of Parks and Recreation are not responsible for any injury, loss of life, or loss or damage to a vehicle or its contents resulting from the use of the parking lot. The City of Vancouver and the Vancouver Board of Parks and Recreation, in their sole discretion, may at any time without notice revise the terms and conditions of use for the parking lot, or terminate its use as a temporary respite area at any time, for any reason, without any notice and without any liability to any person or business entity.
properties.Comments: IMPORTANT ADVISORY/RESTRICTION: Bobtails (i.e., tractor-only) and 1-10 ton truck and trailer combinations are allowed in the lot. Tractor and semi-trailer combinations are not allowed due to turning radius constraints. The power unit (i.e., tractor or truck), must either be base-plated in another jurisdiction (e.g., AB, WA etc.) or if base-plated in BC, the rating territory on the vehicle registration/insurance documents must be a rating territory other than D (Lower Mainland) or E (Maple Ridge/Pitt Meadows) as per ICBC's Basic Insurance Tariff, Schedule A. Consistent with NSC Bulletin 01-2020 (Link), drivers and carriers are advised to ensure that they maintain records to clearly indicate the driver is actively providing COVID-19 relief and make those records available to a bylaw enforcement officer or a peace officer if asked to do so. Additionally, the trailer or semi-trailer, as applicable, must at all times remain hitched to the power unit (i.e., no unhitched trailers or semi-trailers are permitted in a temporary respite area at any time).
properties.DirectionsToWashroom: A gas station is located across the street from the parking lot. Google Directions
properties.DirectionsToFood: Multiple food options are available on East Hastings Street. Google Directions
properties.ParkingSpaces: Unknown.  IMPORTANT ADVISORY/RESTRICTION: Bobtails (i.e., tractor only) and 1-10 ton truck and trailer combinations are allowed in the lot. Tractor and semi-trailer combinations are not allowed due to turning radius constraints.
